title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Getting started
text: IMPORTANT NOTE: geneOncoX requires R version 4.1 higher installed

title: Getting started
text: shows retrieve basic gene cancer relevant gene annotations, including retrieve tumor suppressor genes, proto-oncogenes, predicted cancer driver genes.
code: library(geneOncoX)  ## load the data download_dir <- tempdir() gene_basic <- get_basic(cache_dir = download_dir) #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:51] Downloading remote dataset from Google Drive to cache_dir #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:55] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpsdmZds', argument force_download = FALSE #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:55] Object 'gene_basic' sucessfully loaded #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:55] md5 checksum is valid: b0df83f15b25e4c4e277867d9f80437f #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:55] Retrieved 65000 records  ## Number of records nrow(gene_basic$records) #> [1] 65000  ## Show metadata for underlying resources gene_basic$metadata #>                             source #> 1                       CancerMine #> 2          Network of Cancer Genes #> 3                          IntoGen #> 4               Cancer Gene Census #> 5                             NCBI #> 6        Bailey et al., Cell, 2018 #> 7  Sanchez-Vega et al., Cell, 2018 #> 8                            F1CDx #> 9                           TSO500 #> 10        DNA repair gene database #> 11                          dbNSFP #>                                                                             source_description #> 1          Predicted tumor suppressors/oncogenes/cancer drivers from text mining of literature #> 2                                                                  Tumor suppressors/oncogenes #> 3                                                                Predicted cancer driver genes #> 4  Collection of cancer-relevant genes (soma/germline), tumor suppressors/oncogene annotations #> 5        Basic gene identifiers (symbol, entrez ID, HGNC ID, name, synonyms, function summary) #> 6                           Predicted cancer driver genes / likely false positive driver genes #> 7                                         Collection of curated signalling pathway annotations #> 8                      Collection of genes covered by Foundation One's F1CDx cancer gene panel #> 9                           Collection of genes covered by Illumina's TSO500 cancer gene panel #> 10                                                  Collection of genes involved in DNA repair #> 11             Gene indispensability prediction, loss-of-function intolerance predictions etc. #>                                                                   source_url #> 1                                         http://bionlp.bcgsc.ca/cancermine/ #> 2                                                      http://ncg.kcl.ac.uk/ #> 3 title: Getting started
code: ## Get tumor suppressor genes - as indicated from either ## Cancer Gene Census (CGC) or Network of Cancer Genes (NCG) ## - show literature support from CancerMine  tsg <- gene_basic$records |>   dplyr::filter(cgc_tsg == TRUE |                   ncg_tsg == TRUE) |>   dplyr::select(symbol, entrezgene, name, gene_biotype,                 cgc_tsg, ncg_tsg, cancermine_cit_links_tsg,                  ncbi_function_summary) |>   dplyr::rename(support_cancermine = cancermine_cit_links_tsg)  ## Make as datatable tsg_table <- DT::datatable(   tsg,    escape = FALSE,   extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"),    width = "100%",   options = list(     buttons = c("csv", "excel"), dom = "Bfrtip"))

title: Getting started
code: ## Get proto-oncogenes - as indicated from either ## Cancer Gene Census (CGC) or Network of Cancer Genes (NCG), ## - show literature support from CancerMine oncogene <- gene_basic$records |>   dplyr::filter(cgc_oncogene == TRUE |                   ncg_oncogene == TRUE) |>   dplyr::select(symbol, entrezgene,                  name, gene_biotype,                 cgc_tsg, ncg_tsg,                  cancermine_cit_links_oncogene,                  ncbi_function_summary) |>   dplyr::rename(support_cancermine =                    cancermine_cit_links_oncogene)  ## Make as datatable oncogene_table <- DT::datatable(   oncogene,    escape = FALSE,   extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"),    width = "100%",   options = list(     buttons = c("csv", "excel"),      dom = "Bfrtip"))

title: Getting started
code: ## Get predicted cancer driver genes - as indicated from either ## - Cancer Gene Census (CGC) - tier1/tier2 ## - Network of Cancer Genes (NCG) - canonical drivers ## - IntOGen mutational driver catalogue ## - TCGA's PanCancer driver prediction (Bailey et al., Cell, 2018) ## ##  Rank hits by how many sources that contribute to classification ## cancer_driver <- gene_basic$records |>   dplyr::filter(cgc_driver_tier1 == TRUE |                 cgc_driver_tier2 == TRUE |                 intogen_driver == TRUE |                 ncg_driver == TRUE |                 tcga_driver == TRUE) |>   dplyr::mutate(driver_score = 0) |>   dplyr::mutate(driver_score = dplyr::if_else(     cgc_driver_tier1 == T,      driver_score + 2,     as.numeric(driver_score))) |>   dplyr::mutate(driver_score = dplyr::if_else(     cgc_driver_tier2 == T,      driver_score + 1,     as.numeric(driver_score))) |>   dplyr::mutate(driver_score = dplyr::if_else(     intogen_driver == T,      driver_score + 1,     as.numeric(driver_score))) |>   dplyr::mutate(driver_score = dplyr::if_else(     ncg_driver == T,      driver_score + 1,     as.numeric(driver_score))) |>   dplyr::mutate(driver_score = dplyr::if_else(     tcga_driver == T,      driver_score + 1,     as.numeric(driver_score))) |>   dplyr::select(symbol, entrezgene,                  name, gene_biotype,                 cgc_driver_tier1,                 cgc_driver_tier2,                 intogen_driver,                 #intogen_phenotype,                 intogen_role,                 ncg_driver,                 ncg_phenotype,                 tcga_driver,                 driver_score,                 cancermine_cit_links_driver,                  ncbi_function_summary) |>   dplyr::rename(support_cancermine =                    cancermine_cit_links_driver) |>   dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(driver_score), symbol)  ## Make as datatable driver_table <- DT::datatable(   cancer_driver,    escape = FALSE,   extensions = c("Buttons", "Responsive"),    width = "100%",   options = list(     buttons = c("csv", "excel"),      dom = "Bfrtip"))

title: Getting started
text: show retrieve known cancer predisposition genes, utilizing multiple sources, including Cancer Gene Census, Genomics England PanelApp, TCGA’s pan-cancer study germline variants, /user-curated entries.
code: ## load the data gene_predisposition <- get_predisposition(cache_dir = download_dir) #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:56] Downloading remote dataset from Google Drive to cache_dir #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:57] Reading from cache_dir = '/tmp/RtmpsdmZds', argument force_download = FALSE #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:57] Object 'gene_predisposition' sucessfully loaded #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:57] md5 checksum is valid: 22ecdca6feabad551670a616e7113470 #> INFO  [2024-03-09 11:21:57] Retrieved 609 records  ## Number of cancer predisposition genes nrow(gene_predisposition$records |> dplyr::filter(   !stringr::str_detect(cpg_source, "^ACMG_SF$") )) #> [1] 562  ## Get statistics regarding how reference sources on  ## cancer predisposition genes contribute ## ## CGC - Cancer Gene Census (germline) ## PANEL_APP - N = 43 gene panels for inherited cancer conditions/ ##             cancer syndromes (Genomics England PanelApp) ## CURATED_OTHER - curated/user-contributed genes ## TCGA_PANCAN_2018 - TCGA's pancancer analysis of ##                    germline variants in cancer ##                    (Huang et al., Cell, 2019) ## ACMG_SF - Secondary findings list (ACMG, v3.1) plyr::count(gene_predisposition$records$cpg_source) |>   dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(freq)) |>   dplyr::filter(x != "ACMG_SF") #>                                         x freq #> 1                               PANEL_APP  280 #> 2                           CURATED_OTHER  106 #> 3          CGC&PANEL_APP&TCGA_PANCAN_2018   57 #> 4              PANEL_APP&TCGA_PANCAN_2018   45 #> 5  ACMG_SF&CGC&PANEL_APP&TCGA_PANCAN_2018   28 #> 6                                     CGC   14 #> 7                        TCGA_PANCAN_2018   13 #> 8                           CGC&PANEL_APP    8 #> 9                    CGC&TCGA_PANCAN_2018    5 #> 10                      ACMG_SF&PANEL_APP    2 #> 11               ACMG_SF&TCGA_PANCAN_2018    2 #> 12                            ACMG_SF&CGC    1 #> 13           ACMG_SF&CGC&TCGA_PANCAN_2018    1   ## Cancer predisposition metadata gene_predisposition$metadata #>                                        source #> 1                   Genomics England PanelApp #> 2                          Cancer Gene Census #> 3                                        NCBI #> 4                    Huang et al., Cell, 2018 #> 5        Maxwell et al., Am J Hum Genet, 2016 #> 6 Cancer predisposition genes - curated/other #> 7                   ACMG - secondary findings #>                                                                               source_description #> 1 Collection of > 40 dedicated gene panels for various inherited cancer conditions and syndromes #> 2    Collection of cancer-relevant genes (soma/germline), tumor suppressors/oncogene annotations #> 3          Basic gene identifiers (symbol, entrez ID, HGNC ID, name, synonyms, function summary) #> 4                   Collection of cancer predisposition genes screened in TCGA's pancancer study #> 5                                      Mechanisms of inheritance for cancer predisposition genes #> 6                         Candidate cancer predisposition genes - contributed e.g. by CPSR users #> 7            Genes recommended for reporting of incidental findings in clinical exome sequencing #>                                  source_url #> 1   https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/ #> 2        https://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/census #> 3        https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene/ #> 4 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29625052/ #> 5 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27153395/ #> 6                                      <NA> #> 7 https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35802134/ #>                                   source_citation source_version #> 1        Martin et al., Nat Genet, 2019; 31676867       v1 (API) #> 2   Sondka et al., Nat Rev Cancer, 2018; 30293088            v99 #> 3 Brown et al., Nucleic Acids Res, 2015; 25355515     2024-03-08 #> 4              Huang et al., Cell, 2018; 29625052           <NA> #> 5  Maxwell et al., Am J Hum Genet, 2016; 27153395           <NA> #> 6                                            <NA>       20221128 #> 7        Miller et al., Genet Med, 2023; 37347242           v3.2 #>   source_abbreviation #> 1                gepa #> 2                 cgc #> 3                ncbi #> 4    tcga_pancan_2018 #> 5         maxwell2016 #> 6           cpg_other #> 7             acmg_sf #>                                                             source_license #> 1                               Commercial use requires separate agreement #> 2 Free for non-commercial, academic use. Commercial use requires licensing #> 3                                                 NCBI data usage policies #> 4                                                         Free/open access #> 5                                                         Free/open access #> 6                                                         Free/open access #> 7                                                         Free/open access #>                                                                                 source_license_url #> 1 https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/media/files/GEL_-_PanelApp_Terms_of_Use_December_2019.pdf #> 2                                                       https://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/license #> 3                                           https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/home/about/policies/#data #> 4                                                                                             <NA> #> 5                                                                                             <NA> #> 6                                                                                             <NA> #> 7                                                  https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/clinvar/docs/acmg/

title: Getting started

title: Getting started
code: ## load the data gene_tso500 <- gene_basic$records |>   dplyr::filter(!is.na(illumina_tso500))  ## number of genes covered by TSO500 panel nrow(gene_tso500) #> [1] 523  ## types of variant types covered illumina_tso500_variant_freq <- as.data.frame(   gene_tso500 |>   dplyr::group_by(illumina_tso500) |>   dplyr::summarise(n = dplyr::n()) |>   dplyr::arrange(desc(n)))  illumina_tso500_variant_freq #>                 illumina_tso500   n #> 1                     SNV_INDEL 433 #> 2            CNA_GAIN,SNV_INDEL  33 #> 3          RNA_FUSION,SNV_INDEL  31 #> 4 CNA_GAIN,RNA_FUSION,SNV_INDEL  22 #> 5 CNA_LOSS,RNA_FUSION,SNV_INDEL   2 #> 6            CNA_LOSS,SNV_INDEL   2

code: @Manual{,   title = {geneOncoX: Human gene annotations for the oncology domain},   author = {Sigve Nakken},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.8.1},   url = {https://github.com/sigven/geneOncoX}, }

what: Human gene annotations for the oncology domain
title: Human gene annotations for the oncology domain
text: human genes implicated tumor development? geneOncoX R package address question integration number resources respect cancer gene annotations, including, limited : IntOGen - compendium mutational cancer driver genes Network Cancer Genes - collection curated cancer genes CancerMine - text-mined predictions tumor suppressor genes, proto-oncogenes cancer drivers Cancer Gene Census - manually curated resource cancer genes (soma germline) DNA repair genes - collection genes involved DNA repair Genomics England PanelApp - collections cancer gene panels used clinical diagnostics TSO500 targets - cancer genes targeted Illumina’s TSO500 gene panel F1CDx targets - cancer genes targeted Foundation One’s F1CDx gene panel package offers pre-processed datasets, along metadata, user can retrieve use projects set-ups. package utilizes googledrive R package download pre-processed documented datasets local cache directory provided user.

what: Get human gene aliases from NCBI — get_alias
title: Get human gene aliases from NCBI — get_alias
text: Downloads returns dataset indicate ambiguous unambiguous gene aliases/synonyms human genes. Gene aliases less three characters ignored, custom aliases added (source = custom). dataset comes list object, two elements: metadata - data frame metadata regarding annotation resources used records - list gene aliases indicating ambiguous/ non-ambiguous state

title: Get human gene aliases from NCBI — get_alias
Get human gene aliases from NCBI — get_alias
text: cache_dir Local directory data download force_download Logical indicating local cache overwritten (set TRUE re-download file exists cache)

title: Get human gene aliases from NCBI — get_alias
text: metadata - data frame 1 row 6 columns: source - gene annotation source annotation_data - type annotations used url - URL annotation resource citation - publication cite annotation source (citation; PMID) version - version used/datestamp abbreviation - abbreviation used column names records records - data frame 177,916 rows 5 columns: alias - gene alias/synonym symbol - primary symbol entrezgene - Entrez gene identifier n_primary_map - number primary symbols linked alias ambiguous - logical indicating alias ambiguous source - source gene synonyms (NCBI, custom)

title: Get human gene aliases from NCBI — get_alias

what: Get basic cancer-relevant gene annotations — get_basic
title: Get basic cancer-relevant gene annotations — get_basic
text: Downloads returns dataset combines multiple human cancer gene annotations,.e. IntOGen, CancerMine, Network Cancer Genes, Cancer Gene Census, NCBI, dbNSFP etc. dataset comes list object, two elements: metadata - data frame metadata regarding annotation resources used records - data frame gene annotations (one record per gene)

title: Get basic cancer-relevant gene annotations — get_basic
Get basic cancer-relevant gene annotations — get_basic
text: cache_dir Local directory data download force_download Logical indicating local cache overwritten (set TRUE re-download file exists cache)

title: Get basic cancer-relevant gene annotations — get_basic
text: metadata - data frame 10 rows 6 columns: source - gene annotation source annotation_data - type annotations used url - URL annotation resource citation - publication cite annotation source (citation; PMID) version - version used abbreviation - abbreviation used column names records records - data frame 108,648 rows 65 columns: entrezgene - NCBI Entrez identifier symbol - primary gene symbol gene_biotype - type gene (ncRNA, protein-coding, pseudo) name - gene name other_genename_designations - gene name designations hgnc_id - HGNC gene identifier ncbi_function_summary - gene function summary (NCBI Gene) cgc_hallmark - Annotated cancer gene hallmarks(s) Cancer Gene Census (CGC) cgc_tier - Cancer Gene Census tier (TIER1/TIER2) cgc_driver_tier1 - Logical indicating gene part Cancer Gene Census - TIER1 cgc_driver_tier2 - Logical indicating gene part Cancer Gene Census - TIER2 cgc_tsg - tumor suppressor gene (Cancer Gene Census) cgc_oncogene - proto-oncogene (Cancer Gene Census) cgc_somatic - logical indicating whether cancer relevance gene relates soma (Cancer Gene Census) cgc_phenotype_somatic - cancer phenotypes relevant somatic mutations gene (Cancer Gene Census) cgc_germline - logical indicating whether cancer relevance gene relates germline (Cancer Gene Census) cgc_phenotype_germline - cancer phenotypes relevant germline mutations gene (Cancer Gene Census) ncg_driver - canonical cancer driver gene according Network Cancer Genes (NCG) ncg_tsg - tumor suppressor gene (NCG) ncg_oncogene - proto-oncogene (NCG) ncg_phenotype - cancer phenotypes relevant gene (NCG) ncg_pmid - supporting literature identifiers (PMIDs, NCG) intogen_role - cancer driver role (IntOGen) intogen_phenotype - cancer phenotypes relevant gene (IntOGen) intogen_driver - logical indicatin gene predicted cancer driver IntOGen bailey2018_fp_driver - logical indicating whether gene likely false positive driver gene (Bailey et al., Cell, 2018) woods_dnarepair_class - class DNA repair (DNA repair database, Woods et al.) woods_dnarepair_activity - type DNA repair activity involved (DNA repair database, Woods et al.) illumina_tso500 - gene part Illumina's TSO500 panel (SNV_INDEL, CNA_GAIN, CNA_LOSS, RNA_FUSION) foundation_one_f1cdx - gene part Foundation One's F1CDx panel (SNV_INDEL, CNA, FUSION, PROMOTER) sanchezvega2018_signaling_pathway - curated signalling pathways (Sanchez-Vega et al., Cell, 2018) cancermine_pmid_driver - PMIDs support (text mining) role gene driver (CancerMine) cancermine_pmid_oncogene - PMIDs support (text mining) role gene proto-oncogene (CancerMine) cancermine_pmid_tsg - PMIDs support (text mining) role gene tumor suppressor gene (CancerMine) cancermine_doid_driver - cancer phenotypes relevant given role (Disease Ontology identifiers, CancerMine) cancermine_doid_oncogene - cancer phenotypes relevant given role (Disease Ontology identifiers, CancerMine) cancermine_doid_tsg - cancer phenotypes relevant given role (Disease Ontology identifiers, CancerMine) cancermine_n_cit_driver - number citations (PMIDs) support role driver (CancerMine) cancermine_n_cit_oncogene - number citations (PMIDs) support role proto-oncogene (CancerMine) cancermine_n_cit_tsg - number citations (PMIDs) support role tumor suppressor (CancerMine) cancermine_cit_tsg - citations cancer driver support (prob > 0.8, CancerMine) cancermine_cit_oncogene - citations proto-oncogene support (prob > 0.8, max 50, CancerMine) cancermine_cit_driver - citations tumor suppressor gene support (prob > 0.8, CancerMine) cancermine_cit_links_driver - citation links cancer driver support (50 recent, CancerMine) cancermine_cit_links_oncogene - citation links proto-oncogene support (50 recent, CancerMine) cancermine_cit_links_tsg - citation links tumor suppressor gene support (50 recent, CancerMine) mim_id - MIM gene id (HGNC) mim_phenotype_id - MIM (ids) phenotype gene caused associated (dbNSFP, Uniprot) prob_haploinsuffiency - Estimated probability haploinsufficiency gene (doi:10.1371/journal.pgen.1001154) (dbNSFP) gene_indispensability_score - probability prediction gene essential. doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1002886 (dbNSFP) gene_indispensability_pred - Essential ("E") loss--function tolerant ("N") based gene_indispensability_score (dbNSFP) essential_gene_crispr - Essential ("E") Non-essential phenotype-changing ("N") based large scale CRISPR experiments. doi: 10.1126/science.aac7041 (dbNSFP) essential_gene_crispr2 - Essential ("E"), context-Specific essential ("S"), Non-essential phenotype-changing ("N") based large scale CRISPR experiments. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2015.11.015 (dbNSFP) prob_gnomad_lof_intolerant - probability loss--function intolerant (intolerant heterozygous homozygous lof variants) based gnomAD 2.1 data (dbNSFP) prob_gnomad_lof_intolerant_hom - probability intolerant homozygous, heterozygous lof variants based gnomAD 2.1 data (dbNSFP) prob_gnomad_lof_tolerant_null - probability tolerant heterozygous homozygous lof variants based gnomAD 2.1 data (dbNSFP) prob_exac_lof_intolerant - probability loss--function intolerant (intolerant heterozygous homozygous lof variants) based ExAC r0.3 data (dbNSFP) prob_exac_lof_intolerant_hom - probability intolerant homozygous, heterozygous lof variants based ExAC r0.3 data (dbNSFP) prob_exac_lof_tolerant_null - probability tolerant heterozygous homozygous lof variants based ExAC r0.3 data (dbNSFP) prob_exac_nontcga_lof_intolerant - probability loss--function intolerant (intolerant heterozygous homozygous lof variants) based ExAC r0.3 nonTCGA subset (dbNSFP) prob_exac_nontcga_lof_intolerant_hom - probability intolerant homozygous, heterozygous lof variants based ExAC 0.3 nonTCGA subset (dbNSFP) prob_exac_nontcga_lof_tolerant_null - probability tolerant heterozygous homozygous lof variants based ExAC r0.3 nonTCGA subset (dbNSFP) dbnsfp_function_description - gene function description (dbNSFP/UniProtKB)

what: Get human GENCODE transcript dataset — get_gencode
title: Get human GENCODE transcript dataset — get_gencode
text: Downloads returns pre-processed dataset GENCODE transcripts. dataset comes list object, two elements: metadata - data frame metadata regarding annotation resources used records - list two data frames transcripts, one grch37, one grch38 (see specific column format ) GENCODE datasets provided established parsing GENCODE comprehensive gene annotation GTF file valr package, also providing cross-references RefSeq (use biomaRt package), UniProt accessions/identifiers.

title: Get human GENCODE transcript dataset — get_gencode
Get human GENCODE transcript dataset — get_gencode
text: https://www.gencodegenes.org/ https://uniprot.org https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene https://apprisws.bioinfo.cnio.es/landing_page/

title: Get human GENCODE transcript dataset — get_gencode
text: cache_dir Local directory data download force_download Logical indicating local cache overwritten (set TRUE re-download file exists cache) ensembl_release version Ensembl use - dictate version GENCODE used grch38 (e.g. 110 implies GENCODE v44, 109 implies v43, 108 implies v42 )

title: Get human GENCODE transcript dataset — get_gencode
text: metadata - data frame 3 rows 6 columns: source - gene annotation source annotation_data - type annotations used url - URL annotation resource citation - publication cite annotation source (citation; PMID) version - version used abbreviation - abbreviation (e.g. used column names records) records - list one data frame per assembly chrom - chromosome start - transcript start 5kb padding (upstream) end - transcript end 5kb padding (downstream) transcript_start - transcript start transcript_end - transcript end strand - strand ensembl_gene_id - Ensembl gene identifier ensembl_transcript_id - Ensembl transcript identifier ensembl_transcript_id_full - Ensembl transcript identifier (version) ensembl_protein_id - Ensembl protein identifier symbol - official gene symbol hgnc_id - HGNC gene identifier entrezgene - Entrez gene identifier name - genename gene_biotype - gene biotype (GENCODE) transcript_biotype - transcript biotype (GENCODE)) tag - tag (GENCODE)) refseq_protein_id - RefSeq peptide identifier refseq_transcript_id - RefSeq mRNA identifier mane_select - MANE Select mane_plus_clinical - MANE Plus Clinical principal_isoform_flag - Principal isoform tag (APPRIS) uniprot_acc - UniProtKB protein accession uniprot_id - UniProtKB protein identifier ensembl_version - Ensembl version gencode_version - GENCODE version uniprot_version - UniProtKB version list object GENCODE transcripts (records) associated metadata (metadata)
